body.p: Kentucky farmer. He lived in Grayson County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Sultana Crawford. Served as a captain and lieutenant colonel in the 45th State Militia (Co. C) from 1861 to 1863. Appointed as a U.S. Marshall of Leitchfield, Kentucky, with the rank of captain in July 1863. Stationed at Camp Calloway. Served as enrolling officer for Grayson County in 1863. Served as deputy provost marshal in the 2nd Military District of Kentucky in 1863. Reassigned to Louisville from 1864 to 1865. Relocated to Ohio County, Kentucky after the war and engaged in merchandising.
